segments.text: I notice the puddle steadily spreading across the floor, and it makes me feel uneasy.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The thought of someone slipping and falling fills me with dread.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can hardly believe the woman hasn’t noticed yet; she’s so focused on that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s almost frustrating to watch her be so unaware of the chaos brewing behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kitchen, usually a cozy space, feels charged with impending disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I want to scream out, but I know I can’t; it’s not my place.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Still, I can’t help but think that this will end badly if someone doesn’t intervene soon.
segments.speaker: PAR
